00001 # Name:    launcher.tcl
00002 # Author:  Trevor Williams  (phase1geo@gmail.com)
00003 # Date:    5/11/2013
00004 # Brief:   Namespace for the launcher functionality.
00005 
00006 namespace eval launcher {
00007 
00008   source [file join $::tke_dir lib ns.tcl]
00009 
00010   variable launcher_file  [file join $::tke_home launcher.dat]
00011   variable match_commands {}
00012   
00013   array set read_commands {}
00014   array set commands      {}
00015   array set widgets       {}
00016   array set options       {
00017     -results       10
00018   }
00019   array set command_names {
00020     name         0
00021     validate_cmd 1
00022     temporary    2
00023   }
00024   array set command_values {
00025     description    0
00026     command        1
00027     auto_register  2
00028     count          3
00029     search_str     4
00030     detail_command 5
00031   }
00032   
00033   ######################################################################
00034   # Loads the launcher functionality.
00035   proc load {} {
00036   
00037     variable launcher_file
00038     variable read_commands
00039     
00040     if {![catch { open $launcher_file r } rc]} {
00041       array set read_commands [read $rc]
00042       close $rc
00043     }
00044     
00045     # Add preferences traces
00046     trace variable preferences::prefs(Appearance/CommandLauncherEntryFontSize)   w launcher::handle_entry_font_size
00047     trace variable preferences::prefs(Appearance/CommandLauncherPreviewFontSize) w launcher::handle_preview_font_size
00048 
00049   }
00050   
00051   ######################################################################
00052   # Writes the launcher information to the launcher file.
00053   proc write {} {
00054   
00055     variable launcher_file
00056     variable commands
00057     
00058     if {![catch { open $launcher_file w } rc]} {
00059       foreach {name value} [array get commands] {
00060         puts $rc "[list $name] [list $value]"
00061       }
00062       close $rc
00063     }
00064     
00065   }
00066   
00067   ######################################################################
00068   # Launches the command launcher.
00069   proc launch {{mode ""} {show_detail 0}} {
00070   
00071     variable widgets
00072 
00073     if {![winfo exists .lwin]} {
00074       
00075       set widgets(win) .lwin
00076 
00077       ttk::frame $widgets(win) -borderwidth 2
00078 
00079       set widgets(entry) [ttk::entry $widgets(win).entry -width 50 -validate key -validatecommand "launcher::lookup %P {$mode} $show_detail" -invalidcommand {bell}]
00080       
00081       if {[lsearch [font names] launcher_entry] == -1} {
00082         font create launcher_entry -family [font configure [$widgets(entry) cget -font] -family] \
00083           -size [preferences::get Appearance/CommandLauncherEntryFontSize]
00084       }
00085       
00086       $widgets(entry) configure -font launcher_entry
00087   
00088       set widgets(mf) [ttk::frame $widgets(win).mf]
00089       set widgets(lf) [ttk::frame $widgets(win).mf.lf]
00090       set widgets(lb) [listbox $widgets(lf).lb -exportselection 0 -bg white -height 0 -width 35 \
00091         -yscrollcommand "utils::set_yscrollbar $widgets(lf).vb" -listvariable launcher::match_commands]
00092       ttk::scrollbar $widgets(lf).vb -orient vertical -command "$widgets(lb) yview"
00093       
00094       grid rowconfigure    $widgets(lf) 0 -weight 1
00095       grid columnconfigure $widgets(lf) 0 -weight 1
00096       grid $widgets(lf).lb -row 0 -column 0 -sticky news
00097       grid $widgets(lf).vb -row 0 -column 1 -sticky ns
00098       
00099       # Create a special font for the text widget
00100       set widgets(txt) [text $widgets(win).mf.txt -font [font create -size 7] -width 60 -height 15 \
00101                           -relief flat -wrap word -state disabled \
00102                           -fg [utils::get_default_foreground] -bg [utils::get_default_background]]
00103                           
00104       if {[lsearch [font names] launcher_preview] == -1} {
00105         font create launcher_preview -family [font configure [$widgets(txt) cget -font] -family] \
00106           -size [preferences::get Appearance/CommandLauncherPreviewFontSize]
00107       }
00108       
00109       $widgets(txt) configure -font launcher_preview
00110       
00111       grid rowconfigure    $widgets(mf) 0 -weight 1
00112       grid columnconfigure $widgets(mf) 0 -weight 1
00113       grid $widgets(lf)  -row 0 -column 0 -sticky news
00114       grid $widgets(txt) -row 0 -column 1 -sticky news
00115       
00116       # Hide the text widget
00117       grid remove $widgets(txt)
00118       
00119       pack $widgets(entry) -fill x
00120 
00121       # Bind the escape key to exit the window
00122       bind $widgets(win)   <Destroy>  "launcher::handle_win_destroy"
00123       bind $widgets(entry) <Escape>   "destroy $widgets(win)"
00124       bind $widgets(win)   <FocusOut> "destroy $widgets(win)"
00125 
00126       # Position the window in the center of the main window
00127       place $widgets(win) -relx 0.4 -rely 0.25
00128 
00129       # Get current focus and grab
00130       ::tk::SetFocusGrab $widgets(win) $widgets(entry)
00131 
00132       # If we are running in a mode, display the default results
00133       if {$mode ne ""} {
00134         lookup "" $mode $show_detail
00135       }
00136 
00137     }
00138       
00139   }
00140   
00141   ######################################################################
00142   # Called when the launcher window is destroyed.
00143   proc handle_win_destroy {} {
00144 
00145     variable widgets
00146 
00147     # Reset the original focus and grab
00148     ::tk::RestoreFocusGrab $widgets(win) $widgets(entry)
00149       
00150     # Destroy temporary registrations
00151     remove_temporary
00152 
00153   }

00158     
00159     if {[lsearch [font names] launcher_entry] != -1} {
00160       font configure launcher_entry -size [preferences::get Appearance/CommandLauncherEntryFontSize]
00161     }
00162     
00163   }

00169     if {[lsearch [font names] launcher_preview] != -1} {

00175   ############################################################################
00176   # Moves the currently selected command up by one row.
00177   proc move_up {} {
00178 
00179     variable widgets
00180     
00181     set selected [$widgets(lb) curselection]
00182 
00183     if {$selected > 0} {
00184       select [expr $selected - 1]
00185     }
00186 
00187   }
00188 
00189   ############################################################################
00190   # Moves the currently selected command down by one row.
00191   proc move_down {} {
00192     
00193     variable widgets
00194 
00195     set selected [$widgets(lb) curselection]
00196 
00197     if {$selected < [expr [$widgets(lb) size] - 1]} {
00198       select [expr $selected + 1]
00199     }
00200 
00201   }
00202   
00203   ############################################################################
00204   # Selects the current row within the selection table.
00205   proc select {row} {
00206     
00207     variable widgets
00208     variable commands
00209     variable command_values
00210     variable matches
00211     
00212     # Set the selection
00213     $widgets(lb) selection clear 0 end
00214     $widgets(lb) selection set $row $row
00215     $widgets(lb) see $row
00216     
00217     # If the text widget is shown, clear it and display the current detail information
00218     if {[lsearch [grid slaves $widgets(mf)] $widgets(txt)] != -1} {
00219       $widgets(txt) configure -state normal
00220       $widgets(txt) delete 1.0 end
00221       if {[set detail_command [lindex $commands([lindex $matches $row]) $command_values(detail_command)]] ne ""} {
00222         uplevel #0 "$detail_command $widgets(txt)"
00223       }
00224       $widgets(txt) configure -state disabled
00225     }
00226 
00227   }
00228   
00229   ######################################################################
00230   # Adds a new command that is registered for use by the widget.
00231   proc register {name command {detail_command ""} {validate_cmd "launcher::okay"} {auto_register 0}} {
00232 
00233     variable commands
00234     variable read_commands
00235     variable command_names
00236     variable command_values
00237 
00238     # If the read file has not been read, do it now and bind ourselves
00239     if {[array size read_commands] == 0} {
00240       load
00241     }
00242 
00243     # Create default values
00244     set count        0
00245     set search_str   ""
00246     set command_name [get_command_name $name $validate_cmd 0]
00247 
00248     # Update the commands array
00249     if {[llength [array names commands $command_name]] == 0} {
00250       if {[info exists read_commands($command_name)]} {
00251         set count      [lindex $read_commands($command_name) $command_values(count)]
00252         set search_str [lindex $read_commands($command_name) $command_values(search_str)]
00253       }
00254     }
00255 
00256     # Create the command list
00257     set command_value [lrepeat [array size command_values] ""]
00258     lset command_value $command_values(description)    [string trim $name]
00259     lset command_value $command_values(command)        $command
00260     lset command_value $command_values(auto_register)  $auto_register
00261     lset command_value $command_values(count)          $count
00262     lset command_value $command_values(search_str)     $search_str
00263     lset command_value $command_values(detail_command) $detail_command
00264 
00265     # Populate the command in the lookup table
00266     set commands($command_name) $command_value
00267 
00268   }
00269 
00270   ############################################################################
00271   # Adds a new command that is registered for use by the widget but will not
00272   # be saved.
00273   proc register_temp {name command description {order 0x7fffffff} {detail_command ""} {validate_cmd "launcher::okay"}} {
00274 
00275     variable commands
00276     variable command_names
00277     variable command_values
00278     
00279     # Create the command name list
00280     set command_name [get_command_name $name $validate_cmd 1]
00281 
00282     # Create the command value list
00283     set command_value [lrepeat [array size command_values] ""]
00284     lset command_value $command_values(description)    [string trim $description]
00285     lset command_value $command_values(command)        $command
00286     lset command_value $command_values(auto_register)  0
00287     lset command_value $command_values(count)          [expr 0x7fffffff - $order]
00288     lset command_value $command_values(search_str)     $name
00289     lset command_value $command_values(detail_command) $detail_command
00290 
00291     # Populate the command in the lookup table
00292     set commands($command_name) $command_value
00293     
00294     return $command_name
00295 
00296   }

00299   # Unregisters launcher commands that match the given pattern.
00300   proc unregister {name_pattern {command_pattern *} {temp_pattern *}} {
00301   
00302     variable commands
00303     
00304     array unset commands [get_command_name $name_pattern $command_pattern $temp_pattern]
00305     
00306   }

00308   ######################################################################
00309   # Removes all of the temporary registrations.
00310   proc remove_temporary {} {
00311     
00312     # Unregister all temporary registrations
00313     unregister * * 1
00314     
00315   }

00317   ######################################################################
00318   # Returns the command name given the specified values.
00319   proc get_command_name {name validate_cmd temporary} {
00320 
00321     variable command_names
00322 
00323     # Create the command name list
00324     set command_name [lrepeat [array size command_names] ""]
00325     lset command_name $command_names(name)         [string tolower $name]
00326     lset command_name $command_names(validate_cmd) $validate_cmd
00327     lset command_name $command_names(temporary)    $temporary
00328 
00329     return $command_name
00330 
00331   }

00389   ######################################################################
00390   # Called whenever the user enters a value
00391   proc lookup {value mode show_detail} {
00392 
00393     variable widgets
00394     variable commands
00395     variable matches
00396     variable options
00397     variable match_commands
00398     variable command_names
00399     variable command_values
00400     
00401     if {($value ne "") || ($mode ne "")} {
00402 
00403       # Find all of the matches
00404       find_matches $value $mode
00405 
00406       # Get the number of matches
00407       set match_num [llength $matches]
00408 
00409       # Only display results if we have some to display
00410       if {$match_num > 0 } {
00411 
00412         # Limit the match list to the top
00413         if {$match_num > $options(-results)} {
00414           $widgets(lb) configure -height $options(-results)
00415         } else {
00416           $widgets(lb) configure -height $match_num
00417         }
00418         
00419         # If we need to show detail, display the text widget
00420         if {$show_detail} {
00421           grid $widgets(txt)
00422         }
00423 
00424         # Update the table
00425         set match_commands [list]
00426         for {set i 0} {$i < $match_num} {incr i} {
00427           lappend match_commands [lindex $commands([lindex $matches $i]) $command_values(description)]
00428         }
00429 
00430         # Bind up/down and return keys
00431         bind $widgets(entry) <Up>       "launcher::move_up"
00432         bind $widgets(entry) <Down>     "launcher::move_down"
00433         bind $widgets(entry) <Return>   "launcher::execute"
00434         bind $widgets(entry) <Escape>   "destroy $widgets(win)"
00435         bind $widgets(lb)    <Button-1> "launcher::execute"
00436 
00437         # Set tablelist selection to the first entry
00438         select 0
00439 
00440         # Pack the listbox, if it isn't already
00441         if {[catch "pack info $widgets(mf)"]} {    
00442           pack $widgets(mf) -fill both -expand yes
00443         }
00444 
00445       } else {
00446 
00447         # Remove the results frame
00448         pack forget $widgets(mf)
00449 
00450         # Unbind up and down arrows
00451         bind $widgets(entry) <Up>     ""
00452         bind $widgets(entry) <Down>   ""
00453         bind $widgets(entry) <Return> "destroy $widgets(win)"
00454         bind $widgets(entry) <Escape> "destroy $widgets(win)"
00455 
00456       }
00457 
00458     } else {
00459 
00460       # Remove the results frame
00461       pack forget $widgets(mf)
00462 
00463       # Unbind up and down arrows
00464       bind $widgets(entry) <Up>     ""
00465       bind $widgets(entry) <Down>   ""
00466       bind $widgets(entry) <Return> "destroy $widgets(win)"
00467       bind $widgets(entry) <Escape> "destroy $widgets(win)"
00468 
00469     }
00470 
00471     return 1
00472 
00473   }
00474  
00475   ############################################################################
00476   # Updates the contents of the matches array which contains all of the entries
00477   # that match the given user input.
00478   proc find_matches {str mode} {
00479 
00480     variable commands
00481     variable command_names
00482     variable command_values
00483     variable matches
00484     variable curr_states
00485     variable last_url
00486 
00487     set matches [list]
00488     
00489     if {$mode eq ""} {
00490       
00491       switch [string index $str 0] {
00492         "@" {
00493           if {[llength [array names commands [get_command_name * launcher::symbol_okay 1]]] == 0} {
00494             unregister * * 1
00495             set i 0
00496             foreach {procedure pos} [gui::get_symbol_list {}] {
00497               lappend matches [register_temp "@$procedure" "gui::jump_to {} $pos" $procedure $i "" launcher::symbol_okay]
00498               incr i
00499             }
00500           }
00501         }
00502         "," {
00503           if {[llength [array names commands [get_command_name * launcher::marker_okay 1]]] == 0} {
00504             unregister * * 1
00505             set i 0
00506             foreach {marker pos} [gui::get_marker_list {}] {
00507               lappend matches [register_temp ",$marker" "gui::jump_to {} $pos" $marker $i "" launcher::marker_okay]
00508               incr i
00509             }
00510           }
00511         }
00512         "#" {
00513           if {[llength [array names commands [get_command_name * launcher::clip_okay 1]]] == 0} {
00514             unregister * * 1
00515             set i 0
00516             foreach strs [cliphist::get_history] {
00517               lassign $strs name str
00518               lappend matches [register_temp "#$name" [list cliphist::add_to_clipboard $str] $name $i [list cliphist::add_detail $str] launcher::clip_okay]
00519               incr i
00520             }
00521           }
00522         }
00523         ":" {
00524           if {[llength [array names commands [get_command_name * launcher::snip_okay 1]]] == 0} {
00525             unregister * * 1
00526             set i 0
00527             foreach snippet [snippets::get_current_snippets] {
00528               lassign $snippet name value
00529               lappend matches [register_temp ":$name" [list snippets::insert_snippet_into_current {} $value] $name $i "" launcher::snip_okay]
00530               incr i
00531             }
00532           }
00533         }
00534         default {
00535           unregister * * 1
00536           if {([string first {[} $str] == -1) && [handle_calculation $str]} {
00537             # Nothing more to do
00538           } elseif {[regexp {^((https?://)?[a-z0-9\-]+\.[a-z0-9\-\.]+(?:/|(?:/[a-zA-Z0-9!#\$%&'\*\+,\-\.:;=\?@\[\]_~]+)*))$} $str -> url]} {
00539             lappend matches [register_temp "" [list launcher::open_url_and_bookmark $url] "Open URL $url" 0 "" launcher::url_okay]
00540           }
00541         }
00542       }
00543     
00544     }
00545  
00546     # Get the precise match (if one exists)
00547     set results [list]
00548     foreach {name value} [array get commands [get_command_name * * *]] {
00549       if {[lindex $value $command_values(search_str)] eq "$mode$str"} {
00550         if {[eval [lindex $name $command_names(validate_cmd)]]} {
00551           lappend results [list $name $value]
00552         }
00553       }
00554     }
00555     
00556     # Make the string regular expression friendly
00557     set tmpstr [string map {{.} {\.} {*} {\*} {+} {\+} {?} {\?} {[} {\[}} $str]
00558     
00559     # Sort the results by relevance
00560     sort_match_results $results 1
00561 
00562     # Get exact matches that match the beginning of the statement
00563     sort_match_results [get_match_results \{?$mode$tmpstr.*] 0
00564 
00565     # Get all of the exact matches within the string
00566     sort_match_results [get_match_results \{?$mode.*$tmpstr.*] 0
00567 
00568     # Get all of the fuzzy matches
00569     sort_match_results [get_match_results \{?$mode.*[join [string map {{.} {\\\.} {*} {\\\*} {+} {\\\+} {?} {\\\?} {[} {\\\[}} [split $str {}]] .*].*] 1
00570     
00571   }
00572 
00573   ############################################################################
00574   # Searches the list of commands that match the top widget and the given search
00575   # pattern.
00576   proc get_match_results {regex_pattern} {
00577 
00578     variable commands
00579     variable command_names
00580     variable command_values
00581     variable matches
00582 
00583     set results [list]
00584           
00585     foreach name [array name commands -regexp [get_command_name $regex_pattern * *]] {
00586       set value $commands($name)
00587       if {[lsearch -exact $matches $name] == -1} {
00588         set validate_cmd [lindex $name $command_names(validate_cmd)]
00589         if {[eval $validate_cmd]} {
00590           if {$validate_cmd ne "launcher::okay"} {
00591             lset value $command_values(count) [expr [lindex $value $command_values(count)] + 1000000]
00592           }
00593           lappend results [list $name $value]
00594         }
00595       }
00596     }
00597 
00598     return $results
00599 
00600   }
00601 
00602   ############################################################################
00603   # Sorts the results by last accessed time and appends the sorted results
00604   # to the matches list.
00605   proc sort_match_results {results type} {
00606 
00607     variable command_values
00608     variable matches
00609 
00610     # Sort the results by relevance
00611     foreach result [lsort -integer -index [list 1 $command_values(count)] -decreasing $results] {
00612       lappend matches [lindex $result 0]
00613     }
00614 
00615   }
00616 
00617   ############################################################################
00618   # Executes the selected command, saving usage information.
00619   proc execute {} {
00620 
00621     variable widgets
00622     variable matches
00623     variable commands
00624     variable command_values
00625     variable widgets
00626     variable last_command
00627 
00628     # Get the current selection
00629     set row [$widgets(lb) curselection]
00630 
00631     # Retrieve the command name
00632     set command_name [lindex $matches $row]
00633 
00634     # Create the command value
00635     set command_value $commands($command_name)
00636     lset command_value $command_values(count) \
00637       [expr [lindex $command_value $command_values(count)] + 1]
00638     lset command_value $command_values(search_str) \
00639       [$widgets(entry) get]
00640 
00641     # Store the relevance by using the new execution count and the entered search string
00642     set commands($command_name) $command_value
00643     set command [lindex $commands($command_name) $command_values(command)]
00644 
00645     # Store the last command and type
00646     set last_command $command_name
00647 
00648     # Destroy the widget
00649     destroy $widgets(win)
00650     
00651     # Execute the associated command
00652     after 1 [list launcher::execute_helper $command]
00653 
00654   }
00655 
00656   ############################################################################
00657   # Helper procedure for the execute procedure.
00658   proc execute_helper {command} {
00659 
00660     # Execute the command
00661     eval "$command"
00662 
00663     # Write the launcher information
00664     bgproc::command launcher_write launcher::write -cancelable 1
00665 
00666   }
00667   
00668   ############################################################################
00669   # Handles a calculation that is presented on the command-line.  The calculation
00670   # can be either a Tcl expression or a Verilog expression.
00671   proc handle_calculation {str} {
00672 
00673     variable matches
00674     
00675     # Check to see if the string is a valid Tcl expression
00676     if {![catch "expr $str" rc]} {
00677 
00678       lappend matches [register_temp "" [list launcher::copy_calculation $rc] "Copy $rc to clipboard" 0 "" launcher::calc_okay]
00679             
00680       return 1
00681             
00682     }
00683           
00684     return 0
00685     
00686   }
00687 
00688   ############################################################################
00689   # Copies the current calculation to the clipboard.
00690   proc copy_calculation {value} {
00691 
00692     variable last_command
00693 
00694     # Clear the clipboard and add the calculation
00695     clipboard clear
00696     clipboard append $value
00697     
00698     # Add the clipboard content to the clipboard history manager
00699     cliphist::add_from_clipboard
00700 
00701     # Clear the last command so that we don't have the calculated value stuck in memory
00702     set last_command ""
00703 
00704   }
00705         
00706   ######################################################################
00707   # Displays the given URL and bookmarks it.
00708   proc open_url_and_bookmark {url} {
00709     
00710     # Open the URL in the local browser
00711     open_url $url
00712     
00713     # Add the URL to the bookmark list
00714     register "Open bookmarked URL $url" [list launcher::open_url $url]
00715     
00716   }
00717         
00718   ######################################################################
00719   # Shows the given URL and adds it to the URL history if it does not
00720   # exist.
00721   proc open_url {url} {
00722     
00723     # If the URL did not contain the http portion, add it so that the external launcher knows
00724     # this is a URL.
00725     if {[string range $url 0 3] ne "http"} {
00726       set url "http://$url"
00727     }
00728           
00729     # Displays the URL in the local browser
00730     utils::open_file_externally $url
00731           
00732   }
00733   
00734 }
Generated on Mon Mar 30 00:02:06 2015 for TKE by  1.6.3
